methodology: Projects verified through official DFI press releases and project databases from EBRD, EIB, AfDB, and BII websites. Focus on large-scale projects (>$100M) in energy transition and infrastructure announced/active in 2024-2025.

projects.name: Suez Wind Energy BOO Wind Power Plant
projects.description: Africa's largest onshore wind farm with 1.1 GW capacity located in the Gulf of Suez region. The project features 138 turbines implemented in two phases of 550MW each. Expected to generate 4,111 GWh annually, providing energy to over one million households and reducing annual CO2 emissions by approximately 1.71 million tons. Part of Egypt's NWFE program targeting 10 GW renewable capacity.

projects.name: Desert to Power Initiative
projects.region: Burkina Faso, Chad, Djibouti, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Sudan
projects.description: Flagship initiative to create the world's largest solar energy generation zone by harnessing the solar potential of 11 Sahel countries. Aims to generate 10 GW of solar power by 2030 to facilitate electricity access for 250 million people. The program has already generated 3.4 GW including 2.6 GW from renewable sources. AfDB committed $379.6 million for G5 Sahel countries with $150 million from Green Climate Fund.

projects.name: Vifor Wind Farm
projects.description: Romania's largest onshore wind farm with 461 MW capacity featuring 72 wind turbines in Buzău County, southeast Romania. Developed in two phases: Phase 1 (192 MW) and Phase 2 (269 MW). First EBRD-financed project to benefit from Romania's contract-for-difference scheme with 240 MW CfD contract awarded. EBRD provided €76 million total across both phases.

projects.name: Baltica 2 Offshore Wind Farm
projects.description: The EU's largest offshore wind farm under construction with 1.5 GW capacity, located 40 km north of Poland's Baltic shore. Features 107 Siemens Gamesa 14 MW turbines. EIB committed €400 million (part of €1.4 billion package for Baltica 2 and 3), EBRD provided €200 million. Together with Baltica 3, total capacity will be 2.5 GW, doubling PGE's renewable energy portfolio. Strategic investment includes InvestEU, REPowerEU and Recovery and Resilience Facility funds.

projects.name: Green Genius Expansion Program
projects.region: Baltic States, Poland, Romania, and other EU markets
projects.description: EBRD's largest single company equity commitment in the Baltic States with €100 million investment in Lithuanian renewable energy developer Green Genius. Funds allocated to develop and acquire renewable energy projects aiming to deploy more than 2 GW of capacity across multiple European markets. Green Genius portfolio covers solar, wind, biomethane and battery storage. Company has developed 2.7 GW of projects to date with 549 MW completed.

projects.name: Sopi-Tootsi Wind Park
projects.description: Estonia's largest wind farm with 255 MW capacity comprising Sopi (175 MW) and Tootsi (80 MW) facilities. EBRD provided €100 million eight-year loan, with parallel €180 million financing from EIB. The wind park will increase Estonia's electricity generation capacity by 10% and save 480,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions annually. Strategically important to reduce Estonia's reliance on oil shale, which makes up 57% of the country's energy mix.

projects.name: Tenevo Solar PV Plant
projects.description: Bulgaria's first large-scale fully merchant renewable energy plant with 238 MW solar capacity and 315 MW / 760 MWh battery energy storage system (BESS). Located in south-east Bulgaria, it's the first renewable plant over 100 MW selling output without support schemes or corporate PPAs. EBRD provided €50 million with €53-64 million from RBI, totaling €114 million package. Expected to generate 300+ GWh annually and save 250,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions. First use of InvestEU guarantee by EBRD in Bulgaria. First phase already operational.

projects.name: Madrid Water Infrastructure Modernization
projects.description: Comprehensive water infrastructure modernization program for Madrid region serving 7 million people through Canal de Isabel II. €430 million EIB loan supports drinking water production improvements, network strengthening to cut water losses, infrastructure digitalization, energy efficiency upgrades, and wastewater reuse network expansion. Part of EIB's record 2024 water infrastructure investment in Spain (10x average previous years).
projects.technology: Water Management Systems, Digital Infrastructure, Energy Efficiency

projects.name: Romania Solar PV Portfolio
projects.description: €110 million financing package from EBRD and Raiffeisen Bank International to build and operate two solar photovoltaic power plants in south-eastern Romania with total installed capacity of approximately 300 MW. Part of Romania's green transition strategy supporting the country's renewable energy ambitions.

projects.name: Poland Energy Grid Modernization - ORLEN/Energa
projects.description: Major power distribution grid upgrade and expansion program across Poland. EIB approved PLN 3.5 billion (€850 million) financing to ORLEN Group's Energa division for 2024-25. Investment includes adding 830 km of power lines, 320 km of new connections reaching 25,000 new customers, 170,000 smart meters, 1,000 EV charging stations, and increasing renewable energy connection capacity by 1.4 GW. Supports energy transition in northern and central Poland under REPowerEU initiative.
projects.technology: Smart Grid, EV Infrastructure, Grid Expansion

projects.name: Poland Renewable Energy Program - PGE
projects.description: EIB extended over €525 million to Poland's largest utility PGE for renewable energy production expansion. Part of comprehensive energy transition support where EIB Group's Poland financing reached €5.7 billion in 2024 (10% increase), mobilizing €13.5 billion in total investment. Supports REPowerEU objectives for energy independence and green transition acceleration.

projects.name: Sierra Leone Solar Power Project
projects.description: 50 MW greenfield solar power project with over $52 million investment from development finance institutions including BII, FMO, and Proparco. Part of BII's record climate finance investments in Africa where the institution committed £1.09 billion to African companies in 2024, representing 40% increase. BII's 2024 climate finance reached $903 million (41% of overall commitments), supporting renewable energy proliferation across Africa.

data_quality.verification_level: High - All projects verified from official DFI press releases and project databases
data_quality.url_sources: Direct links to official DFI project pages and press releases
data_quality.currency_conversion: All values converted to USD using approximate 2024 exchange rates (EUR 1 = USD 1.08)
